definition: lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: And inevitably among so many boys there were low types too, snakes mixed up with dragons.
sentences.chinese: 未免人多了，就有龍蛇混雜，下流人物在內。

definition: important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
